intro: Persoonia strangeana, commonly known as the strange persoonia, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its unique, elongated, woody fruits that resemble small, twisted horns. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Persoonia strangeana is adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in heathland and coastal environments.
